content_sections.content:
Security camera installation planning for construction sites traditionally relies on disconnected tools: paper blueprints, rough sketches, and guesswork about camera coverage. **This leads to blind spots, wasted resources, and security vulnerabilities.** 

Sensera Systems needed a professional tool that could:
• Accurately overlay PDF site plans on satellite imagery
• Calculate precise camera coverage based on specifications
• Enable collaborative planning between teams
• Generate professional documentation for clients

Interactive map foundation with Leaflet.js for geospatial accuracy;PDF overlay system with transformation controls for blueprint alignment;Drag-and-drop resource placement with real-time visual feedback;Firebase integration for persistence and real-time collaboration;Export system generating professional PDF documentation

The platform combines **three sophisticated systems** working in harmony: 1. *Map & Overlay Engine* • Multi-layer map with satellite/street/grid views • PDF.js integration for blueprint processing • Transform controls for precise alignment • Scale reference system for accurate measurements 2. *Resource Management* • Camera types with FOV visualization • Zone polygons with vertex editing • Real-time coverage calculations • Collision detection and optimization 3. *Collaboration & Export* • Firebase Firestore for real-time sync • Share links with access control • Professional PDF export with legends • Version history and rollback

**1. PDF Overlay Transformation**
Developed a unique system for aligning blueprints with satellite imagery:
• *Drag & drop positioning* with pixel-perfect accuracy
• *Scale reference tool* matching real-world measurements
• *Opacity controls* for seamless blending
• *Rotation handles* for angular alignment

**2. Camera Coverage Visualization**
Created dynamic field-of-view rendering that updates in real-time:
• *Distance rings* showing detection ranges
• *Angular FOV arcs* based on camera specifications
• *Color-coded overlays* for multiple camera types
• *Intersection analysis* identifying redundant coverage

**3. Polygon Zone Editor**
Built a professional-grade polygon editing system:
• *Vertex manipulation* with drag handles
• *Midpoint insertion* for adding vertices
• *Batch operations* for multiple zones
• *Perimeter vs filled zones* with transparency controls

The interface prioritizes **efficiency and clarity** for security professionals: 1. **Resource Panel Architecture** Left panel: Active resources with accordion controls Drag boundary: Resizable sections for workflow optimization Bottom panel: Available resources library 2. **Map Interaction Patterns** Direct manipulation: Drag cameras and zones onto map Contextual controls: Properties appear on selection Visual feedback: Hover states and selection indicators 3. **Progressive Disclosure** Basic mode: Simple drag and drop placement Advanced mode: Precise measurements and angles Expert mode: Keyboard shortcuts and batch operations This design reduced planning time from hours to minutes while maintaining professional accuracy.

Reduced surveillance planning time by 75% through automation;Eliminated coverage blind spots with precise FOV calculations;Enabled remote collaboration between distributed teams;Generated 200+ professional site plans in first month;Achieved 95% user satisfaction score from field technicians;Established new industry standard for surveillance planning tools
